intro: Galium reflexifolium, commonly known as silverleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, usually hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium reflexifolium is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
